episodes.title: Roy Masters Calls  Me a Liar!!
episodes.description: Ken Schram gives me the opportunity to confront Roy about the damaging effects of the meditation.  He barely even allows me to talk, and has a ready assessent of me before I even open my mouth. He has to be repeatedly told - let her talk.  When I explain specifics of the hypnotic aspect of the meditation, Roy hollers - she's lying! she's lying.  Maybe he needs to go back and listen to what his tapes really say.  I was taken aback by his denial of what he actually says on his meditation tapes (before they had cd-roms).  He underestimates the power of my very detailed memory of the content of his meditation exercise.

episodes.title: Roy Masters is Insensitive
episodes.description: This is Linda, who appeared with me on Northwest Afternoon and talked about how her husband's involvement with Roy Masters caused their marriage to break up.  She had gotten counseling from Roy directly, which consisted of hey lady, he's the man you should just follow him and do what he says.  Being a very intelligent woman, she saw the change in her husband was a bad thing and couldn't go along with it.

episodes.title: Roy Masters Calls Steve Hassan a Parasite!
episodes.description: Steve Hassan gets an opportunity to explain the criteria for what constitutes a cult.  This is a continuation from the video Roy Masters Explains the Foundation of Human Understanding.  Roy is not happy with having to appear on the show alongside his "arch enemy", Steve, as this position puts him in a position to have  to defend himself against the accusation that he is a cult leader.  He claims he fits none of the criteria, then unloads a verbal attack on Steve.

episodes.title: Roy Masters Explains the Foundation of Human Understanding
episodes.description: Roy Masters explains how the FHU is not a cult, as it has no teachings, no doctrine, you can't join. Notice how he tells you all about yourself -- when you were young you were violated, you were motivated, you lost your identity, you took on the identity of those around you, you are not your own person.  He whitewashes  everyone with the same brush.  He claims that the FHU's purpose is to help you realize self-actualization.  No, of course there's no mind control going on here.  He strips himself of the totalitariam, authoritative, "I know it all"  personality he exemplifies on his radio show. He gives the audience a nice "soft-shoe" performance. No controversial statements here.  Clever guy.

episodes.title: Roy Masters is Going to Be the Media One Day!!!
episodes.description:
The video quality on this is bad, but the audio is clear.  Roy responds to a comment made by Steve Hassan about controlling the media,and Roy makes the statement: Im going to be the media one day (at 00:29) The audience didn't hear it,but Steve did, and now, thanks to YouTube, you are hearing it.

I'll let you draw your own conclusions about Roy's words.

episodes.title: Roy Masters is the Greatest Leader in the World Today!!
episodes.description: Steve Hassan interacts with an audience member who is a follower of Roy's. Masters keeps grabbing Steve's arm and wants to stop the interaction.

episodes.title: Roy Masters Agrees with Steve Hassan!!!  Town Meeting  1989
episodes.description: A hypnotherapist in the audience takes offence to both Steve and Roy about hypnosis.  A classic moment in time, probably the only thing these guys can agree on!!

episodes.title: Roy Masters Gets Praise and Criticism!
episodes.description: Comments and questions from the audience of Town Meeting. One old dude thinks Roy's and Steve's statements support atheism.  Ken Schram quotes from "The Hypnosis of Life" and suggests that Masters may be the very psychpath that he warns others about -- to  which the audience responds with a load roar... Two people in the audience give their endorsements for Masters organization -- notice that Roy's "followers" always emphasize the word "understanding" as if using that word makes their involvement with him sound more like enlightenment than entanglement.

episodes.title: Roy Masters Calls Me a Liar Again....
episodes.description: This is my 10th attempt at uploading this.  I had to cut the clip shorter in order to get it uploaded.

episodes.title: Roy Masters  -- the Debate Goes On...
episodes.description: Masters takes great exception to being compared to Jim Jones. Can't really blame him for that, I suppose. Masters tells Ken Schram that he is hypnotizing everyone, then he tells Steve Hassan that he still hasn't gotten over being programmed by the Moonies.  I wish I could dub in that "Twilight Zone" music here, it would really be appropriate.

episodes.title: Roy Masters Says Women Are Evil!!
episodes.description: Roy tries to explain away his statement about "women are the embodiment of evil," and that they have a "serpent within."  He tries to blame all the wickedness in the world on the fact that men don't love women properly;  however, anyway you slice it, according to Masters' convoluted theories all the evil in the world enters through the  woman.

episodes.title: Roy Masters is Not a Cult Leader! (is he?)
episodes.description: Segment following the Intro to Town Meeting which leads into the segment called Roy Masters Explains the FHU. Roy does not appreciate being associated with the likes of Bagwan Shree Rashneesh or JZ Knight the Ramtha channeler.  Some famous Roy quotes -- such as "Knowledge .... makes beasts of us."  Chew on that a while.
